verses.roman:
dui'nāndī' 'prastāvanā', dui'saṁghaṭanā'
pṛthak kariyā likhi kariyā bhāvanā

synonyms: dui nāndī—two invocations of good fortune; prastāvanā—introductions; dui—two; saṁghaṭanā—chains of events; pṛthak kariyā—making separate; likhi—I shall write; kariyā bhāvanā—thinking about them.
translation: I shall write two separate invocations of good fortune and two different introductions. Let me think deeply about the matter and then describe two different sets of incidents."

purport.content: The two works are Vidagdha-mādhava and Lalita-mādhava. Vidagdha-mādhava describes pastimes in Vṛndāvana, and Lalita-mādhava describes pastimes in Dvārakā and Mathurā.
